author: Five Binaries
title: Websocket link for Blockfrost API
description: There is a severe lack of support for WebSockets within the Cardano APIs.

assessments.note: WebSocket are important to reduce latency of client applications. This proposal will be useful when there is a Decentralised exchange on Cardano. However, the need is already covered today with Ogmios. If a developer really has this need, they could run a cardano node themselves.
assessments.reply: The reviewer claims that this is already possible with Ogmios and the local node, but this is not true, as it is only support local mini-protocols (so local node state). Reference: https://ogmios.dev/api-reference.html

assessments.note: Improve Scaling for the already established API Gateway Blockfrost is a very good fit to the challenge.  It will make an already existing solution better and well prepared for future requirements.
Having web socket support will cut down effort and cost of incoming and existing developers.

Availability of WebSocket will provide an option to app developers to write responsive applications. BlockForest APIs have contributed substantially in these nascent stages of NFT and native tokens. Therefore an availability of alternate protocol in very reasonable effort is likely to contribute to the system further.
Blockfrost is already established as a trusted partner in the Cardano ecosystem. Several successful products use Blockfrost. The provided information make an successful implementation very likely.
This is a well known team, already had number of proposals.

Blockforest API is currently the leading Cardano blockchain API providers. The services are being used by quite a few develers. With this as the experience it is very likely that the proposers will be able to implement that process in timely manner.
They estimate 150h of eng work, without more details.
There are specific and details milestones defined for 3, 6 and 12 months in the proposal. The Project itself should not be to complicated to audit, as not many parties are needed to implement is.
What happens after the one year support that the proposers are offering? Will that leave developers and DApps with a problem?
The timeline is defined along with the clear goal items.
The HTTP service will be free and the proposer is expected to release the code in opensource. The progress is highly objective and monitoring it is feasible and auditable.

solution: Build a Websocket link for Blockfrost API standard to enable developers to better optimize their applications.
experience: We are the creators of Blockfrost.io, creating services and tools lowering barriers to entry for developers.
